abstracts.cdata!:
The structural adjustment program aims
            at establishing a competitive market economy in Hungary,
            restoring a reasonable and sustainable growth rate,
            improving the country's external creditworthiness, and
            reducing the inflation rate. Policy reforms to improve the
            performance of enterprises form the core of the economic
            program. These include : i) the reform of ownership interest
            in state enterprises (SEs); ii) to facilitate transformation
            of SEs into modern corporate forms and to promote their
            privatization; iii) measures to increase competitiveness in
            markets, including further liberalization of imports; iv)
            decontrol of prices; v) the reform of the financial system;
            vi) strengthening of financial discipline in enterprises and
            banks; and vii) promotion of a dynamic private sector and of
            small and medium enterprises. The program combines these
            structural reforms with tight monetary and fiscal policies
            to control domestic demand an and active exchange rate
            policy to stimulate production of tradables. A comprehensive
            reform of social programs (including housing, social
            security, pension and family allowances) will also be
            implemented to ensure that the adverse short-term
            consequences of the structural reforms are mitigated.
